feed.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [GRA1][Dedicated Servers] - Rack G135B18
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jul 23, 00:00 - 02:00 UTC

Jun 3, 16:17 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our public and private networks (Vrack) in the rack G135B18.

Start time : 23/07/2025 00:00 UTC
End time : 23/07/2025 02:00 UTC
Service impact : Public and private networks (Vrack) will be temporarily unavailable for servers located in the specified rack during the maintenance.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be doing a maintenance on a network equipment.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [RBX][Storage and Backups] - NAS HA maintenance notification
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jul 8, 11:30 - 17:00 UTC

Jun 23, 12:35 UTC
Update - Operations have been rescheduled.

The new dates are listed below:
Start time : 08/07/2025 11:30 UTC
End time : 08/07/2025 16:00 UTC
Service impact : Impacted services might experience some input/output freezes for storage equipment during the maintenance.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will perform an update on the storage servers hosting your data.
This version will improve certain security mechanisms, as well as some performance enhancements.
During the maintenance period, your data will remain available.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [RBX6][Dedicated Servers] - Racks 41E12
entry.content:
Jun 26, 12:29 UTC
Identified - We have determined the origin of the incident affecting our Dedicated Servers offering on the specified racks.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 26/06/2025 11:55 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : All servers in the racks 41E12 are temporarily unavailable.
Customers Impact : Customers are temporarily unable to access and use their servers located on the specified racks.
Root Cause : This incident is caused by an electrical equipment issue.
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

entry.title: [GLOBAL][Baremetal] - Debian-10-based rescue system (rescue-customer boot mode) removal
entry.content:
Jun 23, 11:38 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jun 23, 09:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Apr 17, 14:50 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Baremetal offer.

Start time : 23/06/2025 09:00 UTC
End time : 23/06/2025 13:00 UTC
Service impact : The Debian-10-based rescue system (rescue-customer boot mode) will no longer be available after 23/06/2025.
Service improvement : The objective of this maintenance is to remove the Debian-10-based rescue system (rescue-customer boot mode) for all Baremetal products.
Customers should start using the new Debian-12-based rescue system (rescue12-customer).

Thank you for your understanding.
